activities: Ethicon, Inc. and Ethicon Endo Surgery,Inc., referred to herein collectively as “Ethicon”, receives personal information in various forms relating to personnel including prospective and former employees. These data are transferred from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland to the United States and are used to carry out the company’s human resources functions.  Ethicon receives and maintains from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland customer business registration information and business associated registration information through website for clinical and marketing purposes.  Ethicon also receives personal information about research subjects, patients, investigators and staff, service providers and healthcare professionals all in support of Ethicon's clinical research operations.  The World Customer Quality and Customer Support teams receive personal informatin from the EU /EES in the regularoty reporting of complaints and adverse events.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human Resources, Clinical Operations, Complaint Handling/Adverse Events, Customer Support and Marketing
recoursemech: For HR Data: EU Data Protection Authority (EU DPAs) Panel and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).  We will employ JAMS for Marketing, Complaints and Clinical Data.
